South Korea's Yoon says better Japan ties helping deter North Korea threatSouth Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol said on Friday improved ties with Japan were helping to combat threats from Pyongyang's weapons developments and called for help from the international community to bring about unification with North Korea. Fri, 01 Mar 2024 03:44:19 GMT CJN46T4XF5MMRNKPNWIATL54EE https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/south-korea-yoon-says-better-japan-ties-helping-deter-north-korea-threat-2024-03-01/Reuters世界亚太地区
With Labour in his sights, left-winger Galloway wins in English townVeteran left-wing political maverick George Galloway won a vote to become the new lawmaker for the English town of Rochdale on Friday, vowing to be a thorn in the side for the opposition Labour Party before a national election it is tipped to win. Fri, 01 Mar 2024 03:04:44 GMT WX2ERUG2FFJZFIIIG3封装2VQ https://www.reuters.com/world/uk/with-labour-his-sights-left-winger-galloway-wins-english-town-2024-03-01/Elizabeth Piper世界英国
Taiwan faces steady 'drip' of pressure as China tightens pre-inauguration squeezeTaiwan is facing a steady "drip, drip" of Chinese pressure ahead of the inauguration of its next president in May, with officials in Taipei fearing Beijing could further squeeze the island's room to manoeuvre without resorting to direct conflict. Fri, 01 Mar 2024 02:59:36 GMT 6KX3SDFKLJOTHFQG4QQ6H7TWYU https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/taiwan-faces-steady-drip-Pressure-china-tightens-pre-inauguration-squeeze-2024-03-01/Yimou Lee, Ben Blanchard世界亚太地区
New species of Amazon anaconda, world's largest snake, discoveredResearchers in the Amazon have discovered the world's largest snake species - an enormous green anaconda - in Ecuador's rainforest that split off from its closest relatives 10 million years ago though they still nearly look identical to this day. Fri, 01 Mar 2024 02:03:58 GMT N55PH2S6BJPZPAWVCDL3462BJQ https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/new-species-amazon-anaconda-worlds-largest-snake-discovered-2024-03-01/Reuters可持续发展气候与能源
Hardliners set to tighten grip in Iran vote as frustration mountsIran elects a new parliament on Friday in a vote that will test the popularity of the country's hardline clerical rulers, with mounting public dissent over economic woes and restrictions on political and social freedoms set to keep many Iranians at home. Fri, 01 Mar 2024 01:47:38 GMT MMCNQGH3HFMZXJ6O332A4CAW3M https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/hardliners-set-tight-grip-iran-vote-frustration-mounts-2024-03-01/Reuters世界中东地区
New Zealand court orders millions in fines and compensation over deadly volcanic eruptionA New Zealand court on Friday ordered the tour booking agents and managers of an island where a volcanic eruption killed 22 people to pay survivors more than NZ$10 million ($6.1 million) and fined them around NZ$2.6 million. Fri, 01 Mar 2024 01:46:31 GMT Q3UZFXP3Q5KJ7PY5JRN2XV2VBM https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/new-zealand-court-orders-millions-of-fines-compensation-over-deadly-volcanic-2024-03-01/Reuters商业环境
Vietnam eyes crackdown on workers rights, foreign aid, report saysVietnam's ruling Communist Party has directed officials to control trade unions as the country prepares to expand workers' rights, alongside closely monitoring foreign organisations and citizens travelling abroad, according to an advocacy group. Fri, 01 Mar 2024 01:06:35 GMT MELA5ZG7RKBZD5C5KOGJZ27PI https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/vietnam-eyes-crackdown-workers-rights-foreign-aid-report-says-2024-03-01/Reuters世界亚太地区
UN chief says Gaza killing could require independent investigationUnited Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Thursday said the killing of over 100 people seeking humanitarian aid in Gaza was a situation that would require an effective independent investigation. Fri, 01 Mar 2024 00:55:45 GMT OTTHFC4RLNPBJFZ66PWRY2BCCM https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/un-chief-says-gaza-killing-could-require-independent-investigation-2024-03-01/Reuters世界中东地区
Some US lawmakers urge Biden, Blinken not to recognize new Pakistan governmentThirty-one members of the U.S. Congress have signed a letter to President Joe Biden and Secretary of State Antony Blinken urging them to not recognize a new government in Pakistan until an investigation of election interference has been conducted. US says it struck missiles, drone that posed threat to Red Sea shipsThe U.S. military said it conducted strikes on Thursday against six mobile anti-ship cruise missiles and an aerial drone that posed a threat to ships in the Red Sea. Alexei Navalny to be buried in Moscow amid uncertainty, tight securityRussian opposition politician Alexei Navalny will be buried in Moscow later on Friday amid tight security and fears of a police crackdown two weeks after he suddenly died at the age of 47 in an Arctic penal colony. Fri, 01 Mar 2024 00:05:26 GMT 2MRUSUTRD5MV7DDBVIONDM4TXQ https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/alexei-navalny-to-be-buried-moscow-amid-uncertainty-tight-security-2024-03-01/Reuters世界欧洲
